page.title: 09THE CANAL
page.content: The canal near St.Patricks School is part of the Stratford Upon Avon Canal.It was built in 1793.In 1825 the Earlswood reservoirs were built to give water to the canal and the reservoir and the canal were built on fifty acres of common. For the fifty acres they paid Â£969 to the church wardens of Tanworth,who were Thomas Burman and Insull Burman of Hill Farm,Lady Lane. The money was to be held in trust by the church-wardens for the needs of the parish. Today the canal is used carrying some coal but mainly pleasure boats go along it with holidaymakers.
